top_categories.workout_context: 350 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Unbound XL's pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 350 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Unbound XL's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
14,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 350 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
350 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Unbound XL, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Unbound XL, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Unbound XL's pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
14,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 14,000ft of climbing on pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.heat: May in Emporia, Kansas. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Unbound XL — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 350 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 350 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Unbound XL. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Unbound XL demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 350 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 350 miles of pure limestone gravel — sharp edges regularly destroy tires, constant line-choice decisions in Emporia, Kansas.
